# Overview

*weathergenr* is an R package for generating synthetic weather series
using a multivariate, gridded, stochastic weather generator. It builds
on the methodology introduced by [Steinscheineder et al
(2013)](https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/wrcr.20528),
and provides an efficient, user-friendly implementation tailored for
climate and hydrological studies.

Key features include:

üìÇ Support for gridded NetCDF datasets  
‚öôÔ∏è Script automation and enhanced usability  
‚ö° Significant performance gains via vectorized and parallelized code

# Installation

Before installing, make sure you have:

- [R](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/) installed  
- An R IDE such as [RStudio](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/)

To install the development version of `weathergenr` from GitHub:

``` r

# install.packages("devtools")
# devtools::install_github("Deltares/weathergenr")
```

# Quick start

Work-in-progress tutorials and examples are available below:

  
[üìò Getting
Started](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/blob/Dev/Vignettes/getting_started.md)  

Stay tuned - more vignettes and usage examples will be added as the
package evolves.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`apply_climate_perturbations()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/apply_climate_perturbations.md)
  : Apply Climate Change Perturbations to Gridded Weather Data
- [`evaluate_weather_generator()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/evaluate_weather_generator.md)
  : Evaluate Stochastic Weather Generator Performance
- [`filter_warm_simulations()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/filter_warm_simulations.md)
  : Filter and sample WARM simulations using distributional, tail, and
  wavelet criteria
- [`find_leap_days()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/find_leap_days.md)
  : Find leap-day positions (Feb 29) in a date vector
- [`generate_weather_series()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/generate_weather_series.md)
  : Generate Synthetic Gridded Daily Weather Series
- [`get_result_index()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/get_result_index.md)
  : Safely Get or Sample an Index from a Vector
- [`get_state_indices()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/get_state_indices.md)
  : Get Indices for a Specific Occurrence State Transition
- [`get_water_year()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/get_water_year.md)
  : Calculate Water Year from Date Vector
- [`knn_sample()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/knn_sample.md)
  : K-Nearest Neighbor (KNN) Sampling from Candidates
- [`make_noleap_dates()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/make_noleap_dates.md)
  : Generate a no-leap (365-day) daily date sequence
- [`markov_next_state()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/markov_next_state.md)
  : Determine Next State in a First-Order Markov Chain
- [`monthly_markov_probs()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/monthly_markov_probs.md)
  : Estimate Monthly Occurrence-State Markov Transition Probabilities
- [`pet_hargreaves()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/pet_hargreaves.md)
  : Estimate Monthly Potential Evapotranspiration (Hargreaves Method)
- [`plot(`*`<qmap_diagnostics>`*`)`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/plot.qmap_diagnostics.md)
  : Plot method for qmap_diagnostics
- [`plot_global_wavelet_spectrum()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/plot_global_wavelet_spectrum.md)
  : Plot Global Wavelet Spectrum
- [`plot_wavelet_spectra()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/plot_wavelet_spectra.md)
  : Plot Wavelet Power Spectrum and Global Wavelet Spectrum
- [`print(`*`<qmap_diagnostics>`*`)`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/print.qmap_diagnostics.md)
  : Print method for qmap_diagnostics
- [`quantile_mapping()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/quantile_mapping.md)
  : Quantile Mapping for Climate Change Perturbation of Precipitation
- [`read_netcdf()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/read_netcdf.md)
  : Read a gridded NetCDF file into tidy weather format (fast + memory
  efficient)
- [`resample_weather_dates()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/resample_weather_dates.md)
  : Resample Daily Weather Dates Using Annual KNN and Markov Chain Logic
- [`summary(`*`<qmap_diagnostics>`*`)`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/summary.qmap_diagnostics.md)
  : Summary method for qmap_diagnostics
- [`validate_quantile_mapping()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/validate_quantile_mapping.md)
  : Compute Validation Diagnostics for Quantile Mapping
- [`wavelet_arima()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/wavelet_arima.md)
  : Wavelet Autoregressive Modeling (WARM)
- [`wavelet_spectral_analysis()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/wavelet_spectral_analysis.md)
  : Continuous Wavelet Spectral Analysis with COI-Aware Significance
- [`write_netcdf()`](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/reference/write_netcdf.md)
  : Write Gridded Data to a NetCDF File (Template-Based)

# Articles

### Articles

- [Getting Started with
  weathergenr](https://github.com/Deltares-research/weathergenr/articles/getting_started.md):

  Read NetCDF inputs, generate stochastic realizations, and evaluate
  generator skill.
